JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , in the NORP region of GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Ms N. ORG , a lawyer practising in the same village .
On DATE ORG and the former GPE concluded an agreement on the mutual resettlement of NORP from GPE and NORP from GPE .
In DATE the applicant ’s family was moved from GPE to GPE . In GPE they left behind property , namely a house , a garden and a QUANTITY plot of land .

In DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG against ORG , ORG , ORG , and ORG seeking recovery of the property which had belonged to his father and mother who had died in DATE and DATE respectively .

On DATE the court found against the applicant . It established that he was CARDINAL of the heirs of his deceased parents and on this basis he had claimed compensation for the property left behind by them in GPE DATE . According to information obtained by the court from ORG , payments to resettled people had been conducted through local governments prior to DATE and special funds had been allocated for the implementation of the Agreement of DATE . The court further noted that since DATE no funds had been allocated for implementation of the above - mentioned Agreement and current NORP legislation did not provide for compensation for property left behind in GPE . On this basis , the court rejected the applicant ’s claim as unsubstantiated .

On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court . Having agreed with its reasoning , the court of appeal noted that the applicant had not proved that his father had not received any compensation for the property in question or that his father had made any claims for such compensation whilst he had still been alive and during the period that such compensation had been paid .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal in cassation as unsubstantiated .

The Agreement between ORG and the Government of the NORP GPE on the evacuation of NORP citizens from the territory of the GPE and of the NORP population from the territory of GPE ( GPE pomiędzy ORG a ORG Republiki Rad dotyczący ewakuacji obywateli polskich z terytorium GPE i ludności ukraińskiej z terytorium ORG між ORG і Польським NORP визволення про евакуацію українського населення з території NORP і польських громадян з території УРСР – “ the Agreement ” ) was signed on DATE and entered into force the same day . It was officially published in ORG DATE , on DATE .
The Agreement provided , in so far as relevant , as follows :
Article CARDINAL

“ ... The Government of the NORP GPE declares that [ persons ] evacuated to the territory of the GPE Soviet GPE shall be settled according to their wishes either on a collective farm or on a plot of land to be used as an individual farm , such plot to be no smaller than that used prior to the evacuation up to a maximum of QUANTITY per farm ... ”
Article CARDINAL
CARDINAL . The following benefits shall be established for persons evacuated from the NORP ORG to GPE and from GPE to the territory of the NORP ORG :
( a ) the writing off of all arrears accumulated by such persons in respect of deliveries in kind , pecuniary taxes and insurance premiums ; ...
( c ) NORP exemption from all State pecuniary taxes and insurance premiums due in DATE and DATE in respect of all the evacuated households , both on the territory of GPE and on the territory of GPE ;
( d ) the grant of a DATE pecuniary loan of MONEY or zlotys per household to evacuees at the place of their resettlement for their financial and other needs ; ...

CARDINAL . Evacuees shall be allowed to take with them clothing , footwear , linen , bedding , foodstuffs , household goods , farming inventory stock , harnesses and other articles for household and agricultural use , up to a total weight of QUANTITY per family , as well as any cattle and poultry belonging to the evacuated farm .

CARDINAL . Persons with specialised professions , such as workmen , craftsmen , doctors , artists and scholars , shall be accorded the right to take with them objects needed in the exercise of their professions .
CARDINAL . The following may not be taken upon evacuation :
( a ) NORP cash , banknotes and gold and silver coins of any type , with the exception of NORP banknotes up to a maximum of MONEY per person , or NORP currency up to a maximum of MONEY per person ;
( b ) NORP gold and platinum in alloy , powder or scrap form ;
( c ) precious stones in unworked form ;
( d ) works of art and antiques whenever they constitute a collection , or even as individual items , unless they are the evacuated person ’s family property ;
( e ) firearms ( with the exception of hunting rifles ) and military equipment ;
( f ) photographs ( other than personal photographs ) , charts and maps ;
( g ) automobiles and motorcycles ;
( h ) furniture , whether by rail or by motor vehicle , because of the transport problems caused by the war .

CARDINAL . The value of movable belongings left behind upon evacuation , and also of immovable property , shall be returned to the evacuated person on the basis of insurance valuations , in accordance with the applicable laws in GPE and in the NORP GPE , as the case may be . In the absence of an insurance valuation , the value of movable and immovable property shall be assessed by ORG of the Parties . The Contracting Parties shall undertake to ensure that town and village houses vacated as a result of resettlement are made available to resettled persons on a priority basis . ”

On DATE the Government of GPE and ORG , the NORP GPE , the GPE Soviet GPE and the Lithuanian Soviet Socialist Republic concluded an agreement on the mutual settlement of accounts in connection with the evacuation of population groups and the delimitation of the NORP - Soviet State border ( Umowa między PERSON , z jednej strony i ORG Republik Radzieckich , PERSON , PERSON Republiki Radzieckiej i ORG PERSON , z drugiej strony , o wzajemnych rozliczeniach , wynikłych w związku z ewakuacją ludności i delimitacją polsko - radzieckiej granicy państwowej CARDINAL “ the DATE LAW ) . LAW provided :

“ With a view to the complete and definitive mutual settlement of accounts for movable and immovable property , agricultural products and seed left on the territories of GPE and of the GPE by persons evacuated and resettled in connection with the delimitation of the NORP - Soviet State border , the Government of GPE undertake to pay the Government of the GPE the sum of CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) MONEY . ”

In GPE no specific legislation has been adopted or commitment made to compensate former NORP residents who were resettled in GPE under LAW DATE . However , in DATE other legislative measures have been introduced .

In DATE the Cabinet of Ministers of GPE submitted a War Veterans ( Amendment ) PERSON to PERSON ( “ ORG ” ) . The bill mentioned for the first time people resettled in GPE . ORG passed the bill with some amendments . In particular , they introduced a requirement of proof of work during the war , depending on the age of the person concerned . In its final version of DATE , as enacted by ORG , the relevant parts of LAW read as follows :
Section CARDINAL . Persons to be considered war participants
“ The following persons shall be considered war participants :

( CARDINAL) ... Persons who worked during the Great Patriotic War in territories which after DATE were integrated into the former ORG , and persons who were resettled after DATE on the territory of GPE from the territory of other GPE , as well as citizens who were assigned by ORG bodies of the former GPE to work in countries allied to the GPE , shall also be considered war participants .

For persons who were born on or prior to DATE and have valid reasons for failing to submit documentary evidence of their work during the war , the status of war participant may be established by a motion of a special committee under the procedure established by ORG .
For persons born after DATE , the status of war participant may be established only by the production of documents and other evidence that unequivocally prove that they worked during the war ... ”

By LAW of DATE , section CARDINAL was changed and the categories of resettled persons , including individuals resettled prior to and in DATE , were listed separately in a new paragraph of the LAW with no other conditions attached . This provision reads as follows :
“ ... ( CARDINAL ) persons resettled after DATE on the territory of GPE from the territory of other GPE . ”
The decree provides for a number of events to commemorate the forced resettlement but is silent on the question of compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage for those who were resettled .

This bill was submitted to ORG in DATE but was not adopted . LAW bill proposed compensating resettled people for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage by granting them war - participant status and facilitating their travel to GPE to visit the areas where they had previously resided . The bill further stated that provision could be made in domestic legislation for other benefits and forms of compensation to be furnished to resettled people .
“ International treaties that are in force and have been agreed to be binding by the Verkhovna Rada of GPE are part of the national legislation of GPE . ”

“ ... [ I]nternational treaties concluded and duly ratified by GPE shall constitute an inalienable part of the national legislation of GPE and shall be applied according to the rank prescribed for norms of national legislation . ”
Section CARDINAL - Validity of International Treaties of GPE on GPE

“ CARDINAL . International treaties that are in force and agreed to be binding by PERSON of GPE are part of the national legislation of GPE and are applied in the order foreseen for the norms of national legislation ... ”
